txt.en: 'May we meet again someday, [placeholder].\n\n'Feel free to introduce yourself to the traders and thank them for their service. They have remained to provide aid when our King and Reeve have turned away from us.'
'Stay close, [placeholder]. The Orcs could come upon us at any moment. We must stay upon the road and seek protection at the trader's outpost to the west.'
Instance: A Dangerous Road
'Hold faith that the waggon will hold together.'
The waggon has been overtaken by the Enemy
'Onward! We will be vulnerable until we reach the trader's outpost.'
The waggon has arrived safely at the trader's outpost
'Stay close. My wife and son will remain hidden from sight until we reach the outpost.'
The waggon has been destroyed!
Runald and his family await you at the southern entrance to the village of Elthengels.
'On your guard! Here they come!'
Runald and his family have arrived safely at the trader's outpost along the road.\n\nRunald wishes to thank you for aiding his departure.
'Look out! More have returned!'
'Won't they give up? I hope this is the last of them!'
'We have made it, [placeholder]! The trader's outpost is just ahead.'
'Take heed, [placeholder]! Troll!'
'It seems safe to continue onward.'
'Let us move on, before more of them return.'
'We are most fortunate to have you along as protection.'
'We must press onward. It will not be long before we reach the outpost.'
Escort the waggon along the road
Escort the waggon along the road
Talk to Runald
Do not allow Runald's waggon to be destroyed
Runald and his familly have prepared their waggon, said their farewells, and are ready to begin their dangerous journey south to Edoras.

'We have arrived! We would not have survived the journey without your aid, [placeholder]. We owe you much.\n\n'I must purchase some supplies for my family, and then we will depart the camp at once. We should find safety as we head south into Elfhelm's lands and beyond to Edoras. Farewell, and may fortune find you, friend.'
